channels.desc: Comma-separated list of channel names or IDs where the file will be shared.

content.desc: File contents via a POST variable. If omitting this parameter, you must provide a `file`.

file.desc: File contents via `multipart/form-data`. If omitting this parameter, you must submit `content`.

initial_comment.desc: The message text introducing the file in specified `channels`.

thread_ts.desc: Provide another message's `ts` value to upload this file as a reply. Never use a reply's `ts` value; use its parent instead.

examples:
{
    "ok": true,
    "file": {
        "id": "F0TD00400",
        "created": 1532293501,
        "timestamp": 1532293501,
        "name": "dramacat.gif",

errors.blocked_file_type: Admin has disabled uploading this type of file
errors.channel_not_found: At least one of the values passed for `channels` was invalid.
errors.invalid_channel: One or more channels supplied are invalid
errors.malware_detected: This file may contain a virus or other malware and can't be uploaded to Slack
errors.not_in_channel: Authenticated user is not in the channel.
errors.posting_to_general_channel_denied: An admin has restricted posting to the #general channel.
errors.slack_connect_blocked_file_type: File uploads with certain types are blocked in all Slack Connect communications
errors.slack_connect_clip_sharing_blocked: Admin has disabled Clip sharing in Slack Connect channels
errors.slack_connect_file_upload_sharing_blocke: Admin has disabled File uploads in all Slack Connect communications
errors.invalid_thread_ts: Value passed to thread_ts was invalid
errors.method_deprecated: This API is deprecated. Please refer to https://docs.slack.dev/changelog/2024-04-a-better-way-to-upload-files-is-here-to-stay
